snippet: As part of a broader trend in the region, the United Arab Emirates has moved aggressively to shut down a group that sought political change and a more Islamic government.
abstract: United Arab Emirates began cracking down on political dissent in 2011 after start of Arab uprisings; Islamist group Islah is all but shut down with 94 members, including prominent jurists, academics, even relatives of one of country’s royal families, charged with conspiring to overthrow government.
lead_paragraph: As part of a broader trend in the region, the United Arab Emirates has moved aggressively to shut down a group that sought political change and a more Islamic government.

headline.seo: Emirates Balk at Activism in Region Hit by Uprisings
headline.main: Emirates Balk at Activism in Region Hit by Uprisings
headline.print_headline: Emirates Balk At Activism In Region Hit By Uprisings
